In the given paragraph, the two disease entities are "delayed hemolytic anemia" and "severe malaria." Delayed hemolytic anemia is a condition where there is a decrease in red blood cells after a certain period due to their breakdown, often after the administration of certain medications like artesunate. Severe malaria is a life-threatening form of malaria that requires immediate medical attention and is typically treated with artesunate as the first-line drug, according to the World Health Organization (WHO).
